guide.introduction: They look great outdoors (the globe keeps the wind from blowing out the flame) and nice indoors, too (who doesn’t like hanging candles?), and if you can squeeze a pair of needlenose pliers and string a bead, you’re almost there.
guide.introduction_rendered:
They look great outdoors (the globe keeps the wind from blowing out the flame) and nice indoors, too (who doesn’t like hanging candles?), and if you can squeeze a pair of needlenose pliers and string a bead, you’re almost there.

Relevant parts
  • Light fixtures
  • Beading wire
  • Crimp beads
  • Glass beads
  • Sand
  • Glass votives
  • Candles
Tools
  • Pliers

parts.notes: 6" clear glass ceiling light fixture globes.
Soft Flex nylon-coated stainless steel beading wire (0.019" diameter).

lines.text: Cut 2 pieces of beading wire, each at twice the total length that you want the globe to hang, plus 5".
lines.text_raw: Cut 2 pieces of beading wire, each at twice the total length that you want the globe to hang, plus 5".

lines.text: Hold them together, and slide a crimp bead down to a spot about 2 1⁄2" above the midpoint of the strands. Crimp into place, add 2 more, and crimp those too.
lines.text_raw: Hold them together, and slide a crimp bead down to a spot about 2 1⁄2" above the midpoint of the strands. Crimp into place, add 2 more, and crimp those too.

lines.text: Now, starting from the other end of the beading wires, slide a crimp bead to a spot about 6" from the first 3.
lines.text_raw: Now, starting from the other end of the beading wires, slide a crimp bead to a spot about 6" from the first 3.

lines.text: Part the beading wires between the loose bead and the first 3, and wrap them around the lip of the globe. Slide the loose bead down against the globe so that the wire hugs the narrow underside of its lip (like tightening a necktie), and crimp in place. Add 2 more behind it, and crimp those too. The globe should be securely supported with the wire rigging.
lines.text_raw: Part the beading wires between the loose bead and the first 3, and wrap them around the lip of the globe. Slide the loose bead down against the globe so that the wire hugs the narrow underside of its lip (like tightening a necktie), and crimp in place. Add 2 more behind it, and crimp those too. The globe should be securely supported with the wire rigging.

lines.text: String the glass beads over both wires in each pair, beading the entire length of each, stopping about 3" short of the ends.
lines.text_raw: String the glass beads over both wires in each pair, beading the entire length of each, stopping about 3" short of the ends.

lines.text: Slide 4 large crimp beads over all 4 ends of the wire, and loop the wires by bringing them back through the crimp beads. Squeeze the crimp beads firmly with pliers.
lines.text_raw: Slide 4 large crimp beads over all 4 ends of the wire, and loop the wires by bringing them back through the crimp beads. Squeeze the crimp beads firmly with pliers.

lines.text: Fill the globe about 1 1⁄2" deep with sand or gravel, position the votive, hang the globe, and spark it up.
lines.text_raw: Fill the globe about 1 1⁄2" deep with sand or gravel, position the votive, hang the globe, and spark it up.

guide.summary: Add some moody light to the dark spots in your life with these hanging votives.
guide.title: Hanging Votive Globes
